snippet: Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan have laid out a plan to cut taxes. They have not yet explained why and how it is also an economic-growth plan.
abstract: Capital Ideas column by David Leonhardt observes that Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan have laid out a plan to cut taxes, but have not explained how such a plan will contribute to economic growth; highlights research that has shown that changes in the top tax rate over the last 65 years have not correlated with economic growth.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan have laid out a plan to cut taxes. They have not yet explained why and how it is also an economic-growth plan.

headline.main: Do Tax Cuts Lead to Economic Growth?
headline.print_headline: Do Tax Cuts Lead to Economic Growth?
